derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (in sense 3): probably a shortening of pall-mall. Sense 2 derives from The Mall, a tree-bordered walk in St James's Park, London, so named because it was the site of a pall-mall alley. Sense 1 dates from the 1960s

encyclopedia.content: mall，名词。林荫大道，设在郊区的大规模购物中心，购物街。

entry.tran: （封闭式）大型购物区，购物中心
entry.def: A mall is a very large enclosed shopping area.

means.word_mean: 1. a public area set aside as a pedestrian walk

2. mercantile establishment consisting of a carefully landscaped complex of shops representing leading merchandisers; usually includes restaurants and a convenient parking area; a modern version of the traditional marketplace;
